Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - Change Management (v2.11)
Question: CHNG-01: Do you have a documented and currently followed change management process (CMP)?

Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - Change Management (v2.11)
Question: CHNG-02: Indicate all procedures that are implemented in your CMP. a.) An impact analysis of the upgrade is performed.  b.) The change is appropriately authorized. c.) Changes are made first in a test environment. d.) The ability to implement the upgrades/changes in the production environment is limited to appropriate IT personnel.

Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - Change Management (v2.11)
Question: CHNG-03: Will the Institution be notified of major changes to your environment that could impact the Institution's security posture?

Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - Change Management (v2.11)
Question: CHNG-04: Do clients have the option to not participate in or postpone an upgrade to a new release?

Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - Change Management (v2.11)
Question: CHNG-05: Describe or provide a reference to your solution support strategy in relation to maintaining software currency. (i.e. how many concurrent versions are you willing to run and support?)

Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - Change Management (v2.11)
Question: CHNG-06: Identify the most current version of the software. Detail the percentage of live customers that are utilizing the proposed version of the software as well as each version of the software currently in use.

Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - Change Management (v2.11)
Question: CHNG-07: Does the system support client customizations from one release to another?

Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - Change Management (v2.11)
Question: CHNG-08: Does your organization ensure through policy and procedure (that is currently implemented) that only application software verifiable as authorized, tested, and approved for production, and having met all other requirements and reviews necessary for commissioning, is placed into production?

Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - Change Management (v2.11)
Question: CHNG-09: Do you have a release schedule for product updates?

Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - Change Management (v2.11)
Question: CHNG-10: Do you have a technology roadmap, for the next 2 years, for enhancements and bug fixes for the product/service being assessed?

Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - Change Management (v2.11)
Question: CHNG-11: Is Institution involvement (i.e. technically or organizationally) required during product updates?

Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - Change Management (v2.11)
Question: CHNG-12: Do you have policy and procedure, currently implemented, managing how critical patches are applied to all systems and applications?

Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - Change Management (v2.11)
Question: CHNG-13: Do you have policy and procedure, currently implemented, guiding how security risks are mitigated until patches can be applied?

Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - Change Management (v2.11)
Question: CHNG-14: Are upgrades or system changes installed during off-peak hours or in a manner that does not impact the customer?

Questionnaire Template Name: Higher Education Community Vendor Assessment Tool (HECVAT) - Change Management (v2.11)
Question: CHNG-15: Do procedures exist to provide that emergency changes are documented and authorized (including after the fact approval)?
